title: Pol Cult and Iran and UK institutions

content.question: Which of the following indicates a major difference in how political culture affects institutions?

choices.label: In Iran, the 1979 revolution led to a theocratic system, whereas in the United Kingdom, a history of limited government has led to a democratic system.
In Russia, a high level of political trust has led to a dominant party system, whereas in Mexico, educated voters are more likely to have high levels of political efficacy.
In Nigeria, religious cleavages have impeded democracy, whereas in China, economic development has been aided by a communist past.
In Mexico, charismatic rulers have obtained power through religious tradition, whereas in Nigeria, a history of wars with neighboring countries has led to military dictatorship.

content.answer: In Iran, the 1979 revolution led to a theocratic system, whereas in the United Kingdom, a history of limited government has led to a democratic system.

skill.text: Skill 2.C: Explain the implications of the similarities and differences between countries with different political systems, principles, institutions, processes, policies, and behaviors.
